name: Nigeria
proverb: A man who sweats profusely is the one who eats hot food.

recipe.title: Boiled Yam with Palm Oil Sauce
steps: Boil yam until tender.
Prepare palm oil sauce with pepper and onion.
Serve yam with sauce.

recipe.title: Ugali with Sukuma Wiki
steps: Boil water and add maize flour, stirring until thick.
Cook collard greens with onion and tomato.
Serve ugali with greens.

name: Ghana
proverb: If you do not travel, you will not know how far the river is.

recipe.title: Jollof Rice
steps: Cook rice with tomato stew and spices.
Simmer until rice is tender.
Serve with fried plantain.

name: Ethiopia
proverb: When the webs of the spider unite, they can trap a lion.

recipe.title: Injera with Doro Wat
steps: Prepare sourdough batter and cook spongy flatbread (injera).
Cook chicken stew with berbere spice, onion, and eggs.
Serve doro wat with injera.

name: Egypt
proverb: A man without a donkey is a donkey himself.

recipe.title: Koshari
steps: Cook rice, pasta, and lentils separately.
Fry onions until crispy.
Assemble with spicy tomato sauce and chickpeas.

name: South Africa
proverb: Wisdom is like fire. People take it from others.

recipe.title: Bobotie
steps: Cook minced meat with curry spices, onion, and bread soaked in milk.
Top with an egg custard mixture.
Bake until golden and serve with yellow rice.

name: Morocco
proverb: A small house will hold a hundred friends.

recipe.title: Chicken Tagine
steps: Season chicken with spices and cook with onion and preserved lemon.
Add olives and simmer in a tagine pot.
Serve with bread or couscous.

name: Senegal
proverb: A canoe does not know who is king. When it turns over, everyone gets wet.

recipe.title: Thieboudienne
steps: Cook fish with tomato sauce, vegetables, and spices.
Add rice and simmer until tender.
Serve with extra sauce and vegetables.

name: Tanzania
proverb: Little by little, a little becomes a lot.

recipe.title: Nyama Choma
steps: Marinate beef or goat meat with salt and spices.
Grill over open flames until smoky and tender.
Serve with kachumbari (tomato-onion salad).
